Climate and Weather in Barpathar, India

Barpathar is a small town located in the Dibrugarh district of the state of Assam, India. Situated in the northeastern part of the country, Barpathar experiences a unique climate and weather pattern throughout the year. Let's delve into the details of Barpathar's climate and weather conditions, providing you with a comprehensive understanding of what to expect when visiting or residing in this region.

Geographical Context

Barpathar is situated at an elevation of approximately 104 meters (341 feet) above sea level. It lies within the Brahmaputra Valley, which is known for its fertile soil and lush green landscapes. The town is surrounded by various rivers and water bodies, including the Brahmaputra River and the Dikrong River, which contribute to the local climate and weather patterns.

Temperature

The temperature in Barpathar exhibits distinct seasonal variations. The region experiences a subtropical climate, with hot and humid summers and cool winters. Here is a table summarizing the average monthly temperatures in Barpathar:

Month Average Temperature (°C) January 14 February 16 March 20 April 23 May 25 June 26 July 27 August 27 September 26 October 23 November 19 December 15

As shown in the table, the hottest months in Barpathar are generally May and June, with average temperatures reaching around 25-26°C (77-79°F). The coolest months are December and January, with average temperatures dropping to around 14-15°C (57-59°F). Overall, the temperature remains pleasant for most of the year, except during the peak summer months when it can get quite hot and uncomfortable.

Rainfall

Barpathar experiences a significant amount of rainfall throughout the year, with the monsoon season being the wettest period. The region receives heavy rainfall due to its proximity to the Brahmaputra River and the influence of the Indian monsoon system. Here is a table summarizing the average monthly rainfall in Barpathar:

Month Average Rainfall (mm) January 21 February 39 March 78 April 167 May 276 June 427 July 456 August 362 September 330 October 169 November 47 December 13

As shown in the table, the months of June, July, and August receive the highest amount of rainfall, with average rainfall ranging from 362 to 456 mm (14-18 inches). The period from April to September is considered the monsoon season, characterized by heavy rain showers and occasional thunderstorms. It is advisable to carry appropriate rain gear and plan outdoor activities accordingly during this time.

Humidity

Barpathar experiences high humidity levels throughout the year, especially during the monsoon season. The proximity to rivers and water bodies contributes to the moisture content in the air. The relative humidity in Barpathar typically ranges from 70% to 90%, with the highest levels observed during the monsoon months. This high humidity can make the weather feel even hotter and more uncomfortable during the summer season.

Seasonal Variations

Barpathar witnesses distinct seasonal variations, with each season offering a unique experience. Here is a summary of the different seasons in Barpathar:

Winter (December to February): The winter season in Barpathar is generally mild and cool, with average temperatures ranging from 14-16°C (57-61°F). It is the driest period of the year, characterized by clear skies and pleasant weather.

Spring (March to May): Spring in Barpathar is marked by gradually rising temperatures and increasing humidity. Average temperatures range from 20-26°C (68-79°F), with occasional rain showers towards the end of the season.

Monsoon (June to September): The monsoon season brings heavy rainfall and high humidity to Barpathar. Average temperatures range from 26-27°C (79-81°F), with frequent rain showers and occasional thunderstorms. It is advisable to be prepared for wet conditions during this period.

Autumn (October to November): Autumn in Barpathar is characterized by gradually falling temperatures and decreasing rainfall. Average temperatures range from 19-23°C (66-73°F), with cooler evenings and pleasant weather during the day.

Conclusion

Barpathar, India, experiences a subtropical climate with hot and humid summers, cool winters, and heavy rainfall during the monsoon season. The average temperatures range from 14°C (57°F) in winter to 27°C (81°F) in summer. The town receives the highest amount of rainfall between June and August, with an average of 362-456 mm (14-18 inches) during these months. The high humidity levels throughout the year can make the weather feel even hotter and more uncomfortable during the summer season. It is advisable to be prepared for wet conditions during the monsoon season and to plan outdoor activities accordingly. Overall, Barpathar offers a unique climate and weather experience, contributing to its natural beauty and diverse ecosystems.
